name: NASCAR Drivers with Brooms Multiple Choice Quiz | NASCAR Drivers | 10 Questions

questions.text: At Phoenix in 2004, Dale Earnhardt Jr became the second driver to win his second consecutive race at this track.  Who was the first driver to win two consecutive Nextel Cup races at Phoenix?
questions.explanation:
Davey Allison.

	He won back-to-back races in 1991.

questions.text: Kevin Harvick swept both the Busch and Nextel Cup races in the same weekend at which track in 2005?
questions.explanation:
Bristol.

	Because of a rainout, he won the cup race on Sunday, and the Busch race on Monday.

questions.text: At what track did Jeff Gordon record his first season sweep by winning both the Busch and Winston Cup races in the same weekend?
questions.explanation:
Dover.

	He swept the Dover races in 1996.

questions.text: In 2010, Jamie McMurray won both the Daytona 500 and the Brickyard 400 in the same season. Who was the first driver to accomplish this feat?
questions.explanation:
Dale Jarrett.

	While Jimmie Johnson won both in 2006, Dale Jarrett was the first to do it in 1996.

questions.text: What driver won the three consecutive Bristol races in Winston Cup in 2003 and 2004?
questions.explanation:
Kurt Busch.

	Kurt's first win at Bristol came in 2002, then he won three straight in 2003 and 2004.

questions.text: The Earnhardt name has been pretty darn good at Talladega, winning at least 15 between father and son. From 1999-2003, Big E and Little E combined to win five straight Winston Cups in the fall at Talladega. Who was the driver that won the fall race in 1998 before the Earnhardts began their streak?
questions.explanation:
Dale Jarrett.

	Dale Jarrett won the 1998 Winston 500, then the Earnhardts reeled off five consecutive wins in the fall Talladega race.  Dale Jr won it in 2003 in the number 8 Budweiser Chevrolet, then the streak would end.

questions.text: In 2008, Kyle Busch pulled off the sweep on the two road courses, Sonoma and Watkins Glen. What driver was the first to accomplish this feat?
questions.explanation:
Tony Stewart.

	Tony Stewart swept both road courses enroute to winning his second title in 2005.

questions.text: Although many drivers have come very close to sweeping, the last time in the century that Daytona was swept was in 1982.  Which driver did that?
questions.explanation:
Bobby Allison.

	While a few drivers have won both races, Bobby Allison was the last to win both events in the same year.

questions.text: What car owner won four straight Coca-Cola 600s from 1999-2002?
questions.explanation:
Jack Roush.

	With wins from Jeff Burton in 1999 and 2001, Matt Kenseth in 2000, and Mark Martin in 2002, Jack Roush cars were able to take home four straight trophies from Nascar's longest race.

questions.text: Jeff Gordon has been very good at Talladega in his career. Which of these seasons did he sweep at that track?
questions.explanation:
2007.

	With six wins to his credit, Jeff got the season sweep in 2007 driving both  cars that Nascar produced.  His first win was in the 'old' car while his second win came in the C.O.T.
